message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper is about developing a fast optimizer for text classification and named entity recognition (NER) models. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with natural language processing and computational linguistics. The paper also focuses on machine learning techniques, so cs.LG (Machine Learning) is another likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves developing an optimizer, which falls under the scope of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The use of biased sampling for prioritizing harder examples towards the end of training may also relate to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper mentions the use of NER for computer vision applications, which could relate to cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition).
